intro: Metagentiana serra, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white pubescence, which helps to reduce water loss. Metagentiana serra is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions at high elevations.
